com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class Web

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidNonvisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Web
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component

    public class Web
extends AndroidNonvisibleComponent
implements Component
    The Original Web component provided functions for HTTP GET and POST requests. This new version provides added PUT and DELETE requests.
    Author:
    lizlooney@google.com (Liz Looney), josmasflores@gmail.com (Jose Dominguez)

    • Nested Class Summary

      BuildRequestDataException can be thrown from buildRequestData.
      private static class  Web.CapturedProperties
      The CapturedProperties class captures the current property values from a Web component before an asynchronous request is made.
      private static class  Web.InvalidRequestHeadersException
      InvalidRequestHeadersException can be thrown from processRequestHeaders.

      • ClearCookies

        public void ClearCookies()

      • Get

        public void Get()
        Performs an HTTP GET request using the Url property and retrieves the response.
        If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
        If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

      • PostText

        public void PostText(java.lang.String text)
        Performs an HTTP POST request using the Url property and the specified text.
        Parameters:
        text - the text data for the POST request

      • PostTextWithEncoding

        public void PostTextWithEncoding(java.lang.String text,
                                 java.lang.String encoding)
        Performs an HTTP POST request using the Url property and the specified text.
        Parameters:
        text - the text data for the POST request
        encoding - the character encoding to use when sending the text. If encoding is empty or null, UTF-8 encoding will be used.

      • PostFile

        public void PostFile(java.lang.String path)
        Performs an HTTP POST request using the Url property and data from the specified file, and retrieves the response.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file for the POST request

      • PutText

        public void PutText(java.lang.String text)

        Parameters:

      • Delete

        public void Delete()
        Performs an HTTP DELETE request using the Url property and retrieves the response.
        If the SaveResponse property is true, the response will be saved in a file and the GotFile event will be triggered. The ResponseFileName property can be used to specify the name of the file.
        If the SaveResponse property is false, the GotText event will be triggered.

      • JsonTextDecode

        public java.lang.Object JsonTextDecode(java.lang.String jsonText)
        Decodes the given JSON encoded value to produce a corresponding AppInventor value. A JSON list [x, y, z] decodes to a list (x y z), A JSON object with name A and value B, (denoted as A:B enclosed in curly braces) decodes to a list ((A B)), that is, a list containing the two-element list (A B).
        Parameters:
        jsonText - the JSON text to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded text

      • decodeJsonText

        static java.lang.Object decodeJsonText(java.lang.String jsonText)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Decodes the given JSON encoded value.
        Parameters:
        jsonText - the JSON text to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the JSON text can't be decoded

      • XMLTextDecode

        public java.lang.Object XMLTextDecode(java.lang.String XmlText)
        Decodes the given XML string to produce a list structure. string decodes to a list that contains a pair of tag and string. More generally, if obj1, obj2, ... are tag-delimited XML strings, then obj1 obj2 ... decodes to a list that contains a pair whose first element is tag and whose second element is the list of the decoded obj's, ordered alphabetically by tags. Examples: 123 decodes to a one-item list containing the pair (foo, 123) 1 2 3 decodes to a one-item list containing the pair (foo,"1 2 3") 1 2 3456 decodes to a list containing the pair (a,X) where X is a 2-item list that contains the pair (bar,123) and the pair (foo,"1 2 3"). If the sequence of obj's mixes tag-delimited and non-tag-delimited items, then the non-tag-delimited items are pulled out of the sequence and wrapped with a "content" tag. For example, decoding 456many1 2 3apples is similar to above, except that the list X is a 3-item list that contains the additional pair whose first item is the string "content", and whose second item is the list (many, apples). This method signals an error and returns the empty list if the result is not well-formed XML.
        Parameters:
        jsonText - the JSON text to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded text

      • HtmlTextDecode

        public java.lang.String HtmlTextDecode(java.lang.String htmlText)
        Decodes the given HTML text value. 
         HTML Character Entities such as &, <, >, ', and " are
 changed to &, <, >, ', and ".
 Entities such as &#xhhhh, and &#nnnn are changed to the appropriate characters.
        Parameters:
        htmlText - the HTML text to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded text

      • openConnection

        private static java.net.HttpURLConnection openConnection(Web.CapturedProperties webProps,
                                                         java.lang.String httpVerb)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException,
                                                         java.lang.ClassCastException,
                                                         java.net.ProtocolException
        Open a connection to the resource and set the HTTP action to PUT or DELETE if it is one of them. GET would be the default, and POST is set in writeRequestData or writeRequestFile
        Parameters:
        webProps - the properties of the connection, set as properties in the component
        httpVerb - One of GET/POST/PUT/DELETE
        Returns:
        a HttpURL Connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassCastException
        java.net.ProtocolException - thrown if the method in setRequestMethod is not correct
